channel.title: INtopBackup
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INtopBackup, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Meet the judge hearing Harvard's lawsuits against the Trump administration
item.description: U.S. District Judge Allison Burroughs is presiding over two Harvard cases challenging Trump's moves to cut federal funding from the university and to ...

item.title: Over what does the Trump admin want to unleash 'dominance'? Find out in the quiz
item.description: Plus: physical fitness, Confederate statues, robot overlords and weird zoo requests.

item.title: Las Vegas sees drop in tourism, hinting at broader economic woes facing the U.S.
item.description: Economists say, what happens in Vegas matters nationally because it often reflects broader trends on consumer confidence and the overall health of the...

item.title: Trump administration cuts McGruff the Crime Dog's fentanyl campaign
item.description: The National Crime Prevention Council is questioning federal cuts to McGruff the Crime Dog's campaign to sniff out fake pills. The group says McGruff'...

item.title: Teen heartthrobs named Bobby were everywhere in the '60s — which was fine by me
item.description: Bobbys were inescapable in music in the '50s and '60s: Bobby Sherman, Bobby Rydell, Bobby Darin and more. NPR critic Bob Mondello looks back to an era...

item.title: Netanyahu divides Israelis and allies with plan for new military push in Gaza
item.description: The Israeli PM's proposals have provoked condemnation from the UK and the UN

item.title: 8/7: The Takeout with Major Garrett
item.description: Higher U.S. tariffs take effect on dozens of countries; What to know about "buy now, pay later" services.

item.title: New suspicion revealed about Australian mushroom triple murderer
item.description: The estranged husband of a woman convicted of killing three people​ with a meal laced with deadly mushrooms suspected his wife had been poisoning him ...

item.title: California rushes to plan a still unscheduled election in US House seats standoff with Texas
Is the world's oldest leader set for an eighth term?
item.description: Cameroon's Paul Biya would stay in power until he's 99 if he wins October's election.

item.title: Crocs US sales tumble as shoppers choose trainers
item.description: The rubber clog-maker claims it is competing with a "clear athletic trend" ahead of the World Cup.

item.title: 8/7: CBS Evening News
item.description: Eli Lilly reports positive results from new weight loss pill; More people turning off dating apps and trying to find love in real life

item.title: UCLA library user borrowed rare Chinese manuscripts, returned fakes, DOJ says
item.description: A UCLA library user who allegedly took home rare Chinese manuscripts and returned fake ones in their place has been charged with stealing items worth ...

item.title: 8/7: The Daily Report
item.description: Nancy Chen reports on the implementation of widespread tariffs and the impact of eating ultra-processed foods.

item.title: South African court rules that Zambia can repatriate body of ex-president
item.description: Edgar Lungu's family has been locked in a bitter dispute with Zambia's government over where to bury him.

item.title: Ghana investigators find 'black boxes' of helicopter that crashed and killed two ministers
item.description: President John Mahama promises a full investigation into what he called a "personal loss".

item.title: Trump’s redistricting fight mushrooms with Vance in Indiana and Florida joining the fray
Trump orders colleges to prove they don’t consider race in admissions
item.description: President Donald Trump on Thursday signed a memorandum requiring colleges to prove they do not consider race in admissions.
